decks.notes: The main concept of this Modern Aggro - Death and Taxes deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by taxing their resources while putting quick pressure on them with aggressive creatures like Thought-Knot Seer, Reality Smasher, and Thalia. The deck aims to control the game with cards like Chalice of the Void and Leonin Arbiter, while utilizing Eldrazi Temple and Gemstone Caverns for mana acceleration. By disrupting the opponent's mana base with cards like Ghost Quarter and Thalia, the deck seeks to outpace and overwhelm the opponent to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on quickly lowering your own life total to power up Death's Shadow, a powerful threat that grows stronger the lower your life total is. The deck includes a mix of early disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, along with efficient creatures like Gurmag Angler and Tasigur, the Golden Fang. The deck also includes card draw and card selection to find the right threats at the right time. Overall, the key strategy is to aggressively attack your opponent while using your own life total as a resource.

The deck focuses on creating a powerful synergy between Pyromancer Ascension and cantrips like Thought Scour, Opt, and Serum Visions to quickly fill the graveyard and generate mana with Manamorphose. This allows the player to cast a high number of spells in a single turn, triggering the Ascension and eventually leading to a lethal Storm count. The inclusion of Thing in the Ice and Bedlam Reveler gives the deck versatility and ways to control the board while still maintaining its explosive combo potential.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal spells, and card draw while ramping up to play Scapeshift to win the game. The goal is to efficiently search for lands and ramp into the combo of Scapeshift and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle to deal massive damage to the opponent. The deck utilizes a mix of control elements, ramp spells, and versatile cards like Bring to Light to assemble the combo and protect it until the win condition is achieved.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly build up powerful, hexproof creatures equipped with auras to deal massive damage and protect them from removal spells. By utilizing cards like Daybreak Coronet, Ethereal Armor, and Rancor, the deck aims to create unstoppable threats that opponents have a hard time dealing with. Leyline of Sanctity ensures protection against targeted spells, while cards like Path to Exile provide removal options. The landbase is designed to support the strategy by providing the necessary colors and mana consistency.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive Human creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The key strategy is to play powerful Humans like Champion of the Parish and Mantis Rider early on, while using cards like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Reflector Mage help control the board and slow down the opponent's plays. Aether Vial allows you to cheat out creatures quickly, and cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Phantasmal Image provide additional support and synergy with your Human creatures.

The focus of this deck is to efficiently assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Mine) to generate a large amount of mana for powerful late-game threats such as Wurmcoil Engine, Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The deck also includes a variety of search cards like Sylvan Scrying and Expedition Map to ensure the UrzaTron lands are found quickly, while also packing removal and control elements like Oblivion Stone and Karn Liberated to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This Aggro-Affinity deck focuses on quickly playing out artifact creatures like Ornithopter and Vault Skirge, equipping them with Cranial Plating and using Steel Overseer to pump up their power. The deck also includes Arcbound Ravager for additional threats and synergy with artifacts. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of fast creature plays and powerful equipment, leveraging the synergy between artifacts to create a strong board presence and aggressive strategy.

The main concept of this Aggro-Affinity deck is to quickly swarm the board with cheap artifacts and creatures, then use cards like Cranial Plating and Arcbound Ravager to pump up their power and attack for massive damage. The deck also includes cards like Karn, Scion of Urza and Steel Overseer to provide additional value and support for the aggressive strategy. The mana base is heavily focused on artifact lands like Darksteel Citadel and mana-producing artifacts like Mox Opal to ensure the deck can consistently play its threats and disrupt opponents.

The main concept of this UR Storm deck is to generate a high amount of mana through rituals and cantrips, while utilizing cards like Baral and Goblin Electromancer to reduce costs. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo pieces, mainly Grapeshot, and cast it multiple times in the same turn to deal lethal damage to the opponent. Past in Flames allows for recursion of key spells, while Gifts Ungiven helps to search for necessary pieces. The deck is focused on efficiency and speed to overwhelm the opponent before they can recover.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent using aggressive creatures and burn spells. The deck aims to win the game as fast as possible by attacking with creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, while also burning the opponent with spells like Lightning Bolt, Boros Charm, and Lava Spike. Eidolon of the Great Revel punishes opponents for casting spells, while Grim Lavamancer provides additional burn damage. The deck runs a low land count to maximize spell efficiency and aims to outpace and overwhelm the opponent before they can mount a defense.

The deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with cards like Goblin Lore and Burning Inquiry to cheat out powerful creatures like Hollow One and Flamewake Phoenix. By utilizing cards that allow for aggressive and explosive plays, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. The combination of graveyard recursion with cards like Bloodghast and Gurmag Angler, as well as direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt, creates a high-paced and relentless strategy that aims to win the game quickly.

This deck focuses on playing low-cost hexproof creatures like Gladecover Scout and Slippery Bogle, then loading them up with powerful aura enchantments to quickly overwhelm the opponent. Key cards include Ethereal Armor and Daybreak Coronet, which can turn a small creature into a massive threat. The deck also includes Leyline of Sanctity to protect against targeted spells and Path to Exile for removal. Overall, the goal is to create an unbeatable creature that can quickly win the game before the opponent has a chance to respond.

The deck focuses on aggressively playing Human creatures with powerful effects, utilizing synergy between cards like Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant to quickly build up a powerful board presence. The deck also includes disruptive creatures like Meddling Mage and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to control the opponent's resources. Aether Vial provides additional flexibility in playing creatures at instant speed, while lands like Ancient Ziggurat and Cavern of Souls help consistently cast creatures. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast, efficient creatures while disrupting their game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through countering spells, drawing cards, and removing threats while setting up a combo win condition with Through the Breach and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. The deck uses versatile cards like Snapcaster Mage and Cryptic Command to maintain tempo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Blood Moon can also shut down non-basic lands, giving the deck additional control elements. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent before closing out the game with a powerful combo finish.

The main concept of this Aggro-Humans deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of powerful creature cards that benefit from each other's presence on the battlefield. By utilizing cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish to pump up the team, along with disruptive cards like Meddling Mage and Reflector Mage to control the opponent's plays, this deck aims to establish early dominance and maintain pressure throughout the game. A combination of aggressive creatures, mana acceleration from Noble Hierarch, and card advantage from Aether Vial help to maintain a fast and efficient game plan.
